hero.description: Discover the elegance and durability of burnt wood, crafted using the ancient Japanese Shou Sugi Ban technique.

spruce.title: Spruce wood
spruce.description: Lightweight yet strong, spruce wood offers a smooth texture and a natural, clean finish. Its versatility and durability make it an excellent choice for both interior and exterior applications.

larch.title: Larch wood
larch.description: Naturally durable and resilient, larch wood is well-suited for outdoor use. Its dense grain and rich tone make it a reliable choice for long-lasting facades and surfaces.

aboutUs.description1: We create burnt wood products using the traditional Japanese Shou Sugi Ban technique, combining craftsmanship with modern quality standards. Each board is carefully charred, brushed, and finished to reveal its natural character.
aboutUs.description2: Our goal is to deliver beautiful, durable wood surfaces that perform in real-world conditions for years. We guide you from concept to installation so every solution is long-lasting and tailored to your project.

paragraphs.p1: We create burnt wood products using the traditional Japanese Shou Sugi Ban technique, combining craftsmanship with modern quality standards.
paragraphs.p2: Our goal is to deliver beautiful, durable wood surfaces that perform in real-world conditions for years.

01.question: What is Shou Sugi Ban?
01.answer: Shou Sugi Ban is an ancient Japanese technique that involves charring wood to protect and enhance its natural beauty. This traditional method originated as a way to make wood more resistant to the elements, including insects, fire, and weathering. The process creates a striking aesthetic with deep tones, unique textures, and an elegant, rustic look.

02.question: How do I maintain Shou Sugi Ban wood?
02.answer: Shou Sugi Ban surfaces are typically low-maintenance. There’s no need for daily cleaning—an occasional gentle rinse to remove dust and dirt (as needed or seasonally) is usually enough. Avoid high-pressure washing and abrasive cleaners, as they can damage the surface texture. If the surface is oiled, refreshing the oil every ~2–5 years is typically sufficient (depending on sun exposure, rain, and facade orientation).

03.question: Where can charred wood products be used?
03.answer: Charred wood (yakisugi) is well-suited for ventilated facades, wall and ceiling cladding, decorative partitions, fences, gates, and exterior accents. Indoors it’s often used for feature walls and furniture details—choose an appropriate finish (e.g., oil or lacquer) to reduce rub-off and make cleaning easier. For outdoor use, longevity depends heavily on correct detailing: ventilation, proper fasteners, and avoiding areas where water can sit on the surface.

04.question: How is Shou Sugi Ban installed?
04.answer: Shou Sugi Ban boards are most commonly installed as ventilated facade cladding on battens/framing, leaving an air gap to help moisture evaporate. Use stainless steel fasteners, follow the recommended expansion gaps, and install with correct water run-off detailing. It’s also a good idea to protect end-grain and cut edges (e.g., with oil/sealer, depending on the system). Before installation, store boards in a dry, ventilated area and pre-drill fastener points when needed to reduce the risk of splitting.

05.question: Is Shou Sugi Ban suitable for interior use?
05.answer: Yes—Shou Sugi Ban works well indoors for feature walls, ceilings, niches, and furniture details. For interior applications we recommend an oiled finish: when properly processed and oiled, the surface does not rub off and does not shed, and it’s easy to maintain.

06.question: Is Yakisugi suitable for all climates?
06.answer: Yakisugi performs well across many climates, but longevity depends on the wood species, charring/brushing intensity, chosen finish, and construction detailing. In humid/coastal conditions and on south-facing elevations (high UV exposure), finishes may need to be refreshed more often. The key is ventilated installation, good drainage/run-off detailing, and avoiding situations where water remains on the surface.

07.question: What are the standard dimensions for Shou Sugi Ban planks?
07.answer: Typical facade board widths are 95–145 mm, with common lengths of 3–6 m (depending on the selected profile and wood species). Exact dimensions depend on your profile choice and project requirements—custom options are also possible.

products.lightweightDescription: Lightweight yet strong, spruce wood offers a smooth texture and a natural, clean finish. Its versatility and durability make it an excellent choice for both interior and exterior applications.

page.heroLead: We are experts in the preparation of burnt wood, with many years of successful experience in preparing wood for facades, terraces, fences and interiors, and we guarantee a high quality and long-lasting result.
page.heroBody: We produce wood prepared according to the unique, time-tested Japanese wood-burning technology "Yakisugi" (or "Shou Sugi Ban"). This is the most natural way of preparing wood, giving it both a protective and aesthetic function. The traditional Japanese woodworking technology, which has been around for centuries, was introduced to protect wood from the effects of the environment. Burning shrinks the pores in the surface of the wood, making it stronger and more resistant. At the same time, it retains its properties, naturalness, pattern and colour.
page.missionBody: Our goal is to help you create a cosy and sustainable environment by using Yakisugi (Shou Sugi Ban)—a traditional Japanese wood-burning technique that enhances both the protection and aesthetics of wood.
page.visionBody: To become the leading provider of sustainable burnt wood solutions in Lithuania and beyond, inspiring people to embrace natural, durable, and eco-friendly materials in architecture and interior design. We strive to preserve tradition while innovating for a greener future.
page.visionBodyMobile: To become the leading provider of sustainable burnt wood solutions in Lithuania and beyond, inspiring people to embrace natural, durable, and eco-friendly materials. We strive to preserve tradition while innovating for a greener future.
page.promiseBody: Whether for facades, terraces, fences, or interior designs, our burnt wood solutions add warmth, style, and lasting protection to your home and surroundings.
page.valueCraftsmanshipBody: We take pride in our work, paying close attention to every detail to ensure the highest quality.
page.valueSustainabilityBody: We believe in eco-friendly solutions that preserve nature while enhancing your living space.
page.valueAuthenticityBody: We honor the centuries-old Yakisugi tradition, delivering wood that retains its natural beauty and strength.
page.valueCraftsmanshipBodyMobile: We take pride in our work, paying close attention to every detail.
page.valueSustainabilityBodyMobile: We believe in eco-friendly solutions that preserve nature.
page.valueAuthenticityBodyMobile: We honor the centuries-old Yakisugi tradition.
page.foundationsBlurbA: We produce burnt wood products using the centuries-old Japanese method that naturally strengthens and preserves wood by shrinking its pores. This process enhances durability while maintaining the wood's natural texture, pattern, and color.
page.foundationsBlurbB: Our skilled craftsmen are meticulous in their work, ensuring every detail meets the highest quality standards. We use the most durable woods—spruce and larch—treated with natural oils to achieve exceptional colours and protection.
page.processBodyA: Burnt wood is produced by burning wood at high temperatures in a special kiln, creating a natural and picturesque wood surface. This process gives the wood unique textures and colors, increases its resistance to moisture and fire
page.processBodyB: So, if you want to give your home or business premises a special and eco-friendly finish, it is worth taking a look at burnt wood. It will give the interior a unique and stylish look, while at the same time helping to contribute to environmental protection.
page.processBodyMobile: Burnt wood is produced by burning wood at high temperatures in a special kiln, creating a natural and picturesque wood surface. This process gives the wood unique textures and colors, increases its resistance to moisture and fire.
page.step1Body: First, the boards are prepared, dust and dirt are removed.
page.step2Body: The wood is heated to very high temperatures, which gives the board unique textures and colors.
page.step3Body: When the board is completely cooled, it is processed and coated with a protective layer.

termsAccordion.termsBody:
1. GENERAL
By placing an order you confirm that you have read and accept these terms.

2. ORDERING
An order is submitted when you complete checkout and confirm payment.

3. PRICES & PAYMENT
All prices are in EUR. Payments are processed via the selected provider.

4. DELIVERY
Delivery timelines and costs are shown at checkout.

5. RETURNS
Returns are handled according to applicable law and our return policy.

6. LIABILITY
We are not liable for delays caused by third parties (couriers, payment providers).

7. CONTACT
For questions, please contact us via the contact page.
termsAccordion.privacyBody:
1. PURPOSE
We process your data to fulfill orders, deliver goods, and communicate with you.

2. DATA COLLECTED
Contact details, delivery address, and order information.

3. RETENTION
We keep data as long as necessary for fulfillment and legal obligations.

4. SHARING
Data may be shared with payment processors and delivery partners.

5. YOUR RIGHTS
You can request access, correction, or deletion of your data.

6. CONTACT
For privacy questions, contact us via the contact page.

facades.description: A modern, ventilated facade system with charred wood cladding — built for the Baltic climate, minimal maintenance, and a clean architectural finish.
facades.intro: Burning wood is an ancient and unique technique that is becoming increasingly popular in modern architecture. The result is wooden facade cladding that provides a modern and robust appearance.
facades.detail: Charred wood cladding not only provides a unique appearance but is also durable and resistant to weather conditions. By properly charring the wood, a modern, nature-inspired aesthetic can be created, suitable for all architectural styles. Furthermore, charred wood serves as a natural defence against external influences, such as pests or harmful ultraviolet rays from the sun.
facades.faqSubtitle: Do you want to give your building a distinctive and appealing look? Encourage diverse design solutions with charred wood.

1.title: Introduction to burnt wood facade cladding
1.content: Burnt wood is an ancient and unique technique becoming increasingly popular in modern architecture. The result is wooden facade cladding that provides a modern and robust appearance. Burnt wood not only provides a unique look but is also durable and resistant, naturally protecting against pests and UV rays.

2.title: Advantages of burnt wood facade cladding
2.content: Burnt wood facade cladding offers numerous benefits: enhanced durability, natural weather resistance, and distinctive aesthetic appeal. Without chemical preservatives, the wood becomes resistant to mold, fungi, and pests.

3.title: Most popular wood types for facade cladding
3.content: Common wood types used for charred facade cladding include larch, pine, spruce, and oak. Each species has unique characteristics and visual appeal. Larch is particularly noted for its excellent moisture resistance.

4.title: Burnt wood facade installation process
4.content: The installation process involves proper surface preparation, selecting the right mounting system, and ensuring adequate ventilation behind the cladding. A ventilated facade is essential for ensuring longevity.

5.title: Cost aspects of burnt wood facade cladding
5.content: While initial costs may be higher than traditional options, the long-term durability and low maintenance requirements make burnt wood an economical choice over the entire lifespan.

terraces.description: Fire-treated decking with natural grip and a refined texture. Built to handle seasonal changes while staying beautiful underfoot.
terraces.intro: Charred wood terraces are a unique solution for outdoor spaces. Modern Shou Sugi Ban technique gives terraces not only a distinctive appearance but also increased resistance to moisture and UV rays.
terraces.detail: A charred terrace features a natural non-slip surface that remains safe even when wet. This finish is barefoot-friendly and perfect for poolside, sauna, or outdoor relaxation areas. The wood becomes more stable and less prone to deformation due to moisture changes.
terraces.faqSubtitle: Looking for a durable and beautiful solution for your outdoor terrace? Charred wood is an excellent choice for a modern space.

1.title: Why choose charred wood for a terrace?
1.content: Charred wood offers a unique combination for terraces – natural beauty and increased durability. The charring process creates a protective layer that shields the wood from moisture, UV rays, and biological pests, while providing an unparalleled aesthetic.

2.title: Is charred wood suitable for pool areas?
2.content: Yes, charred wood is excellent for pool zones. Its natural surface remains non-slip even when wet, and the increased moisture resistance ensures longevity even under constant water exposure.

3.title: How to maintain a charred terrace?
3.content: A charred terrace requires minimal maintenance. Regular dust and debris removal is recommended, and protective oil can be renewed once a year. Avoid high-pressure washing as it may damage the surface.

4.title: What is the lifespan of a charred terrace?
4.content: A properly maintained charred terrace can last 25-30 years and longer. The charring process significantly increases wood resistance to rot and pests, resulting in a longer lifespan than standard wood.

5.title: Can different colors be combined on a terrace?
5.content: Yes, we offer various charred wood colors and tones. You can choose from deep black to lighter shades, depending on the charring intensity and finish. This allows for creating an individual design.

interior.description: Charred wood panels for modern interiors — warmth, contrast, and texture for feature walls, ceilings, and details.
interior.intro: Charred wood in interiors opens unlimited design possibilities. From accent walls to ceiling finishes – Shou Sugi Ban technique gives spaces a unique character and depth.
interior.detail: Charred wood used for interior finishing is specially prepared for indoor spaces – softer texture, fewer carbon residues, and perfectly treated surfaces. It creates a cozy atmosphere and pairs beautifully with modern and minimalist interiors.
interior.faqSubtitle: Looking for a way to add warmth and uniqueness to your interior? Charred wood is the perfect choice for accent walls and ceilings.

1.title: Is charred wood suitable for indoor spaces?
1.content: Yes, charred wood is excellent for indoor spaces. Wood used for interior finishing is specially prepared with lighter charring, fewer carbon particles, and meticulously treated surfaces. It meets all indoor finishing safety requirements.

2.title: What rooms are suitable for charred wood?
2.content: Charred wood suits most rooms: living rooms, bedrooms, offices, restaurants, hotels. It looks particularly effective as an accent wall, ceiling finish, or furniture element. For wet rooms (bathrooms), additional protection is recommended.

3.title: Does charred wood emit odor?
3.content: Newly installed charred wood may have a slight smoky scent that dissipates within a few weeks. Fully finished products with a protective layer have virtually no odor and are suitable even for sensitive individuals.

4.title: How to maintain charred wood indoors?
4.content: Interior charred wood requires minimal maintenance. Regularly remove dust with a dry or slightly damp cloth. Avoid aggressive cleaning agents. It's recommended to renew the protective layer every few years.

5.title: Can charred wood be combined with other materials?
5.content: Charred wood pairs beautifully with various materials: concrete, metal, glass, stone, and natural fabrics. The contrast between dark charred wood and light elements creates a stunning visual effect.

fences.description: Charred wood fencing that stays stable, looks premium, and withstands the elements — for clean lines and long-term durability.
fences.intro: A charred wood fence is more than just a barrier. It's an architectural element that gives your property character and protection while emphasizing contemporary design.
fences.detail: Our charred wood fences feature exceptional longevity and minimal maintenance. The charring process creates natural protection against rot, pests, and UV rays, so the fence maintains its appearance for decades.
fences.faqSubtitle: Looking for a fence that's both functional and aesthetic? Charred wood is the solution that will make your property unique.

1.title: Why is a charred wood fence better than standard?
1.content: Charred wood offers several key advantages: increased resistance to rot and pests, longer service life, less maintenance, and a unique aesthetic appearance that becomes even more impressive with each passing year.

2.title: What is the lifespan of a charred fence?
2.content: A properly installed and minimally maintained charred fence can serve 30-40 years and longer. This is significantly longer than a standard wooden fence, which typically lasts 10-15 years.

3.title: Does the charred fence need painting?
3.content: No, a charred fence does not require painting. The natural charred surface is the protection itself. Protective oil can be periodically renewed, but it's not necessary. The fence naturally ages to a silver tone or remains deep black with oil.

4.title: What fence style options are available?
4.content: We offer various fence styles: horizontal and vertical planks, framed construction, combined options with metal. We can also create custom designs according to your preferences and property architecture.

5.title: Can a charred fence withstand Baltic climate?
5.content: Yes, charred wood is particularly well suited for Baltic climate conditions. The charring process creates a hydrophobic layer that repels moisture. The fence will withstand rain, snow, cold, and heat without any problems.
